description: From Middle French calamité, from Latin calamitās (“loss, damage; disaster”).

entries.meaning: An event resulting in great loss.
The distress that results from some disaster.
examples: They were behind twice, first in the 11th minute when James Morrison scored a goal that was a personal calamity for Hart, and then four minutes into the second half when Kenny Miller eluded Gary Cahill to score with a splendid left-foot drive.
